results.title: Half-half-three-quarters-full = Half half three quarters ful
results.brief_description: A close-up view, of crew racing, from the place of the man at the oars. On the occasion of a North American rowing competition, this film follows a University of British Columbia team through practice, trials and competition

results.title: Hajj: the journey of a lifetime [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Ovidio Salazar and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Join a group of British Muslims including a father and his son, a university student and a Harley Street neurosurgeon (both women) as they make their spiritual journey of discovery on a pilgrimage to the 2001 hajj in Saudi Arabia, along with 20,000 other Britons. For Muslims everywhere, the ultimate goal is to make the hajj at least once during their lifetime. This spiritual journey is the basic premise of an entire religion and sees impoverished African Muslims mixing with their incredibly wealthy Western counterparts. The film covers the entire event from the preparations in England before flying off to Saudi Arabia, their arrival and bus trip to Mecca and the days that follow which take them to Mina and Mount Arafat where they undergo many rites and ceremonies before finally returning to Mecca and flying back home. Interspersed throughout the documentary we are given an insight into each of these traveller’s thoughts and aspirations, through their own personal commentary, of what hajj means to them, their expectations and their actual experiences and why they have embarked on such a pilgrimage. For the Saudis this annual event requires an enormous amount of preparation providing food, water, electricity and tent accommodation for over 2 million pilgrims for the 6 days of the hajj. There are some amazing images throughout the film particularly the circling of the Kabah, but the one overwhelming factor is the patience and good humor of the pilgrims and the spirituality which seems to embody them as a whole in their united belief in Islam. Narrated by Art Malik.

results.title: Hailey National Park
results.brief_description: Hailey National Park in India. Visitors are taken through the park on an elephant to observe the wildlife to be found there including reptiles, spotted deer and jackals. No credits available.

results.title: H.J. Maxwell: railroad engineer
results.creator_credit: Trevor Greenwood and University of California, Los Angeles. Dept. of Theater Arts
results.brief_description: A student documentary interview with H.J. Maxwell as he talks about his nearly 50 years with the Santa Fe Railway. Shows Maxwell working in the rail yards and looks at various procedures and different types of engines.

results.title: H-16 camera with wood and aluminium tripod
results.brief_description:
The home-movie market took off after World War II. Enthusiasts across the world began to document their lives with a series of small, easy-to-use home-movie cameras that shot on 8mm and 16mm film. These were great introductory cameras for filmmakers – particularly the Swiss-made Bolex H16 camera, which is often used in film schools today. Directors and experimental filmmakers like David Lynch, Spike Lee and Maya Deren all started out using the Bolex H16.

H-16 camera with wood and aluminium tripod

Paillard Bolex, Switzerland, c. 1948

results.title: Gymnastics: Just about the best thing going
results.creator_credit: Frank Heimans, Peter Johnson, Cinetel Productions and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A film celebration of the sport of gymnastics. Australian young people, aged seven to fifteen, and others praise the activity as beneficial therapy for poor coordination, improvement of physical fitness, increasing self-confidence and making new friends. They also tell of the necessary discipline and hard work.

results.title: Gymnastics! Fundamentals and techniques. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: Illustrates fundamentals and techniques through the use of close-up, slow motion and regular photography. Includes a complex Free Exercise routine; still and swinging ring events; routines on the side horse; and a horizontal or high bar series includes the fly-away, twist, giant swing, backward giant and hip turn.

results.title: Gymnastics! Fundamentals and techniques. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: Illustrates fundamentals and techniques through the use of close-ups, slow-motion and regular photography. Includes demonstrations on parallel bars, of standard turns, rolls, and stands; rope-climbing; use of the long-horse in vaulting exercises; and tumbling fundamentals such as rolls, handstands, cartwheels, Hecht, somersaults and handsprings.
